newsitem.title: TURKEY: TURKISH SHARES LEAP 2.3 PCT TO NEW ALL-TIME HIGH.
newsitem.headline: TURKISH SHARES LEAP 2.3 PCT TO NEW ALL-TIME HIGH.

text.p: Shares at Istanbul's stock exchange continued a three-week-long uptrend amid selective activity and strong volume on Monday to hit a fresh record.

The IMKB-100 closed at a new all-time high of 78,479.71, up 1,784.85 points, or 2.33 percent from Friday's 76,694.86, the previous record. But it eased from an afternoon high of 79,086 on profit-taking.
Daily trade volume soared to 25.79 trillion lira, including a 3.5 trillion lira block deal on the wholesale market, from Friday's 16.51 trillion.
"A down correction is awaited, but has not yet happened. It looks as though activity will continue this way," said Nazmi Sarikaya, securities manager at Disbank.
The index which surged 7.15 percent last week has gained 21.1 percent since mid-September when the medium-term uptrend began.
Brokers said activity was spearheaded by utilities and largely state owned firms which are highly capitalised and thus have major impact on the market index.

Of the 223 shares traded, gainers overwhelmed losers by 157 to 28 and 38 closed unchanged. The 85-share industrial index put on 2.3 percent to 84,425.27 and the 15-share financial index leapt 2.39 percent to 72,904.11.
Top actives were utilities Cukurova Elektrik, steady at 79,000 lira, Aktas Elektrik, up 4,000 lira at 66,000 and Kepez Elektrik which gained 1,000 lira to 79,000.
They were followed by largely state owned firms slated for privatisation -- flat steel giant Eregli, up 200 lira at 10,000 and petroleum refiner Tupras which jumped 2,000 lira to 17,500.
